SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.connector.instrument

Class FeedConnectorHelper

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.connector.instrument.FeedConnectorHelper
public class FeedConnectorHelper extends Object
Utility class providing helper methods for feed connectors to process financial data from various data providers. This class contains static methods for parsing numbers in different locale formats, making HTTP requests, and processing financial data responses.

  • Method Details

    • parseDoubleGE

      public static Double parseDoubleGE(String item)
      Parses a German-formatted numeric string to Double. German format uses period (.) as thousands separator and comma (,) as decimal separator. Example: "1.234,56" becomes 1234.56
      Parameters:
      item - the German-formatted numeric string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed Double value, or null if the trimmed string is empty
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed as a valid number

    • isCreatableGE

      public static boolean isCreatableGE(String item)
      Checks whether a German-formatted numeric string can be successfully parsed. German format uses period (.) as thousands separator and comma (,) as decimal separator.
      Parameters:
      item - the German-formatted numeric string to validate
      Returns:
      true if the string can be parsed as a valid number, false otherwise

    • parseDoubleUS

      public static Double parseDoubleUS(String item)
      Parses a US-formatted numeric string to Double. US format uses comma (,) as thousands separator and period (.) as decimal separator. Example: "1,234.56" becomes 1234.56
      Parameters:
      item - the US-formatted numeric string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed Double value, or null if the trimmed string is empty
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed as a valid number

    • parseDoubleCH

      public static Double parseDoubleCH(String item)
      Parses a Swiss-formatted numeric string to Double. Swiss format uses apostrophe (') as thousands separator and period (.) as decimal separator. Example: "1'234.56" becomes 1234.56
      Parameters:
      item - the Swiss-formatted numeric string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed Double value, or null if the trimmed string is empty
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed as a valid number

    • parseLongCH

      public static Long parseLongCH(String item)
      Parses a Swiss-formatted numeric string to Long. Swiss format uses apostrophe (') as thousands separator. Example: "1'234'567" becomes 1234567
      Parameters:
      item - the Swiss-formatted numeric string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed Long value, or null if the trimmed string is empty
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed as a valid number

    • parseLongGE

      public static Long parseLongGE(String item)
      Parses a German-formatted numeric string to Long. German format uses period (.) as thousands separator. Example: "1.234.567" becomes 1234567
      Parameters:
      item - the German-formatted numeric string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed Long value, or null if the trimmed string is empty
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed as a valid number

    • getByHttpClient

      public static HttpResponse<String> getByHttpClient(String urlStr) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Performs an HTTP GET request using the default HTTP client configuration. Uses standard user agent and no connection timeout.
      Parameters:
      urlStr - the URL to request
      Returns:
      the HTTP response containing the response body as a string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
      InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted

    • getByHttpClient

      public static HttpResponse<String> getByHttpClient(String urlStr, boolean useRandomAgent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Performs an HTTP GET request with optional random user agent. Uses no connection timeout but allows customization of the user agent string.
      Parameters:
      urlStr - the URL to request
      useRandomAgent - true to use a randomized user agent, false for standard user agent
      Returns:
      the HTTP response containing the response body as a string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
      InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted

    • getByHttpClient

      public static HttpResponse<String> getByHttpClient(String urlStr, Integer seconds) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Performs an HTTP GET request with configurable connection timeout. Uses standard user agent with the specified timeout value.
      Parameters:
      urlStr - the URL to request
      seconds - the connection timeout in seconds, or null for no timeout
      Returns:
      the HTTP response containing the response body as a string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
      InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted

    • getByHttpClient

      public static HttpResponse<String> getByHttpClient(String urlStr, Integer seconds, boolean useRadomAgent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Performs an HTTP GET request with full configuration options. Allows specification of both connection timeout and user agent randomization.
      Parameters:
      urlStr - the URL to request
      seconds - the connection timeout in seconds, or null for no timeout
      useRadomAgent - true to use a randomized user agent, false for standard user agent
      Returns:
      the HTTP response containing the response body as a string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
      InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted

    • getHttpAgentAsString

      public static String getHttpAgentAsString(boolean useRadomAgent)
      Generates a user agent string for HTTP requests. Can provide either a standard user agent or a randomized version to avoid detection.
      Parameters:
      useRadomAgent - true to generate a randomized user agent with random numbers, false to use the standard application user agent
      Returns:
      the user agent string to use in HTTP headers

    • parseResponseLineGE

      public static Historyquote parseResponseLineGE(String inputLine, Date from, Date to, SimpleDateFormat dateFormat) throws ParseException
      Parses a single line of German-formatted financial data response into a Historyquote object. Expected format is semicolon-separated values: date;open;high;low;close;volume Only creates a Historyquote if the parsed date falls within the specified date range.
      Parameters:
      inputLine - the semicolon-separated line to parse
      from - the start date of the acceptable range (inclusive)
      to - the end date of the acceptable range (inclusive)
      dateFormat - the SimpleDateFormat to use for parsing the date field
      Returns:
      a new Historyquote object if the date is within range, null otherwise
      Throws:
      ParseException - if the date field cannot be parsed using the provided format

    • checkFirstLastHistoryquoteAndRemoveWhenOutsideDateRange

      public static List<Historyquote> checkFirstLastHistoryquoteAndRemoveWhenOutsideDateRange(Date fromDate, Date toDate, List<Historyquote> historyquotes, String instrumentName)
      Validates and cleans a list of history quotes by removing entries that fall outside the specified date range. Checks only the first and last entries for efficiency, as the list is expected to be sorted. Logs warnings when quotes are removed.
      Parameters:
      fromDate - the start date of the acceptable range (inclusive)
      toDate - the end date of the acceptable range (inclusive)
      historyquotes - the list of history quotes to validate and clean
      instrumentName - the name of the financial instrument for logging purposes
      Returns:
      the cleaned list with out-of-range quotes removed

    • getGBXLondonDivider

      public static <T extends Securitycurrency<T>> double getGBXLondonDivider(T securitycurrency)
      Calculates the price divider for London Stock Exchange securities quoted in GBX (pence). UK securities are often quoted in pence rather than pounds, requiring division by 100 to convert to the correct currency unit. This method determines whether such conversion is needed based on the security's exchange, currency, and instrument type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of security currency (Security or Currencypair)
      Parameters:
      securitycurrency - the security or currency pair to check
      Returns:
      100.0 if the security requires GBX to GBP conversion, 1.0 otherwise
